sentences.english: The Rossoneri's club will try to emulate in Japan the feat of the Cavallino.
sentences.chinese: 红黑军团也将在日本仿效法拉利一样获得成功。

sentences.english: Something I was more interested in emulating?
sentences.chinese: 我开始对仿效母亲感兴趣。

sentences.english: He called the new building unoriginal and said that it merely aped the classical traditions.
sentences.chinese: 他说这幢新建筑缺乏新意，只是仿效古典传统而已。

sentences.english: You should imitate great and good people.
sentences.chinese: 你应仿效伟大良善的人。

sentences.english: The fadeout follows closely the pattern of the solar flare, being observed at the same time as the flare.
sentences.chinese: 淡出严密仿效日晕的形式，被观察在火光的同时。

sentences.english: In short, there are many models for healthy cross-national competition and partnership.
sentences.chinese: 总之，跨国的健康竞争与合作有许多可以仿效的模式。

sentences.english: The push was modeled in part on how South Korean companies, known as chaebols, expanded in earlier years.
sentences.chinese: 这一作法部分仿效韩国财团企业早些年的扩张方式。

sentences.english: And people want to copy us.
sentences.chinese: 因此人们纷纷想仿效我们。

sentences.english: Imitate Paris and you will ruin yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 仿效巴黎，就会使你破产。

sentences.english: We ought to follow her good example.
sentences.chinese: 她是个好榜样，我们应当仿效她。

sentences.english: Run out and get several copies of this high-spirited school story.
sentences.chinese: 看完并仿效几次这个朝气蓬勃的校园故事吧。

sentences.english: My company became known as a modern example for other firms to follow.
sentences.chinese: 我的公司被大家誉为值得其他企业仿效的现代化榜样。

sentences.english: the best attitudes or behaviors that we would like to see emulated throughout society.
sentences.chinese: 我们期待能供社会仿效的美好态度和行为。

sentences.english: This is a model worth emulating.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个值得仿效的楷模”。

sentences.english: It is designed on the model of the Sydney Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 它是仿效悉尼歌剧院设计的。

sentences.english: It is aping the working pattern of specialists in developed countries.
sentences.chinese: 就是仿效发达国家中的工作模式。

definition: to imitate/to follow the example of
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
course of action/method of doing sth/practice/modus operandi
old system/weights and measures of former times
to adopt (a system, policy, strategy etc)
complete change from the old rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/a volte-face/to change old practices
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
subordinates follow the example of their superiors (idiom)
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
each one does what he thinks is right (idiom)/each goes his own way
